001package org.relationlearn.util.io;
002
003import java.util.Map;
004import org.relationlearn.model.RelationDigraph;
005
006/**
007 * The InputParser interface defines the behaviour of any class that wants
008 * to be used as a way of extracting data from a given input format the user
009 * needs to.
010 * 
011 * @see org.relationlearn.model.RelationDigraph
012 */
013public interface InputParser {
014    
015    /**
016     * Parses data at a given URI and generates a Map containing as many
017     * RelationDigraph instances as the implementation is able to find
018     * in the URI provided.
019     * 
020     * @param uri the URI where the data to be parsed should be found
021     * @return a Map containing all RelationDigraph instances parsed
022     * 
023     * <p>
024     * <b>Note: </b> Although this method is not expected to throw any 
025     * unchecked exceptions, the IllegalArgument exception should be 
026     * thrown in case of a fatal error regarding the input URI.
027     * </p>
028     */
029    public Map<String, RelationDigraph> parseInput(String uri);
030}
